column4: how do you launch gnone from the terminal, just installed Ubuntu and it launched straight into terminal after updating
OK.  "terminal" usually means "terminal window" within an X session.  "console" == text-mode, nongraphical display.
Anyhow, 'startx' should spew a bunch of stuff onto console, particularly if X ("GNOME") doesn't start.  The last few lines should be error messages of some sort.
